Unicorns are among us






news

code



Discover the magical world of unicorns! This post explores the myths, legends, and fascinating facts about these enchanting creatures. Learn how unicorns have inspired stories, art, and imagination throughout history.





Aug 31, 2025












Post With Code






news

code

analysis



This is a detailed description of the post. In this article, we explore how to include and execute code within a Quarto document. The post covers best practices for embedding code blocks, formatting output, and integrating narrative text with code results. Readers will learn how to structure technical content effectively, making it accessible and engaging for a wide audience. Whether you are documenting a data analysis project, sharing programming tips, or writing a technical blog, this guide provides practical examples and clear explanations to help you get started with Quarto.





Aug 30, 2025












SIMP: Squirls In My Pants






news



SIMP: Squirls In My Pants is a lighthearted exploration of quirky coding challenges inspired by everyday moments. This post shares the development journey, highlights creative solutions, and provides practical code examples for readers interested in fun and engaging programming projects.

title: Customizing Your Quarto Blog
text:
Posts










Make your About page about YOU


There are lots of ways to customize your Quarto About page. Hereâ€™s how I did it!



Quarto



Customizing the Quarto About page with text, embeds, and more!





Nov 4, 2023

3 min

â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”


Part 1





No matching items

title: Make your About page about YOU
text:
When I first made my Quarto blog, the first thing I wanted to do was claim it! So hereâ€™s a detailed guide on how to make your About page ABOUT YOU!
Hereâ€™s a link to the Quarto About Page docs.

1ï¸âƒ£ Claim it
Fill in the YAML at the top. Add your name, your picture, and anything you want to highlight. I have LinkedIn and GitHub, but you can add any Bootstrap 5 icon!
title: <name here>
about:
    image: profile.jpg
    template: jolla
    links:
    - icon: linkedin
      text: LinkedIn
      href: <link to LinkedIn profile here
    - icon: github
      text: Github
      href: <link to GitHub account page here>
You should also describe yourself! Avoid big blocks of text - use bullet points, lists, and unique formatting to make it easy to read (and donâ€™t forget to use emojis!)
-   ğŸ‘€ I'm interested in
-   ğŸ’— I'm passionate about
-   ğŸ”­ I'm currently working on ...
-   ğŸŒ± I'm currently learning ...
-   ğŸ’ï¸ I'm looking to collaborate on
-   ğŸ‘¯ I'm looking to collaborate on ...
-   ğŸ¤” I'm looking for help with ...
-   ğŸ’¬ Ask me about ...
-   ğŸ“« How to reach me: ...
-   âš¡ Fun fact: ...






Tip



If you donâ€™t want to have bullet points, have two empty spaces at the end of each line to force a line break!


And donâ€™t forget to add your education and work experience!


2ï¸âƒ£ Embeds
Quarto is the next evolution of R Markdown, meaning itâ€™s a markdown file! Anything that can be embedded in markdown (HTML, iframes, etc.) can be embedded in Quarto.
A non-exhaustive list:

Maps
Videos
Tweets
Instagram Posts
Spotify Playlists
GitHub Gists

I decided on 2 Github stats apps, but you can add anything you want!
![GitHub stats](https://github-readme-stats.vercel.app/api?username=<username>&show_icons=true)
![Top Langs](https://github-readme-stats.vercel.app/api/top-langs/?username=<username>&layout=compact)

I also included the icons of my favorite languages and tools using Skill Icons, and some HTML to center it
<p align="center">
  <a href="https://skillicons.dev"> 
    <img src="https://skillicons.dev/icons?i=py,r,md,github,vscode"/> 
  </a>
</p>

  



3ï¸âƒ£ Templates
Quarto has five templates you can use to make your About page look even better: jolla, trestles, solana, marquee, and broadside. You can see them all here.
I chose jolla because I liked how it was centered like my GitHub stats. To use a template, add the following to your YAML:
about:
  template: solana
If you donâ€™t like your image being a circle or you donâ€™t like the size, you can change it to a rectangle by adding the following to your YAML:
about:
  template: marquee
  image-width: 10em
  image-shape: rectangle

title: Make your About page about YOU sub
